content.text:
You're on v0.4.2 and there's a v0.4.3 available. That said, the issue you're describing — repo-level updates showing but the overview activity not updating — sounds like a dashboard/backend issue on Entire's side rather than a local CLI problem.

A few things to consider:

1. **Update first** — worth ruling out a client-side bug:
   ```bash
   curl -fsSL https://entire.io/install.sh | bash
   ```

2. **It's likely a backend/caching issue on their end** — if individual repo pages show the sessions correctly, the data is making it to their servers. The overview/activity feed is probably a separate aggregation that's lagging or broken. This is a bug on their side.

3. **Check their GitHub issues** — might be a known issue: https://github.com/entireio/cli/issues

Want me to check their GitHub issues for reports of this, or do you want to just update the CLI and see if that fixes it?

Web search results for query: "entire.dev dashboard overview activity not updating individual repos showing sessions 2026"

Links: [{"title":"GitHub - sgibson91/github-activity-dashboard: A tool to help visualise activity in issues and PRs across many repos and orgs","url":"https://github.com/sgibson91/github-activity-dashboard"},{"title":"Recent activities are gone from the top panel · community · Discussion #4227","url":"https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/4227"},{"title":"About your organization dashboard - GitHub Docs","url":"https://docs.github.com/en/organizations/collaborating-with-groups-in-organizations/about-your-organization-dashboard"},{"title":"Pushed a repo but not showing in activity dashboard · community · Discussion #138663","url":"https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/138663"},{"title":"Home Feed does not show releases · community · Discussion #146124","url":"https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/146124"},{"title":"Quickstart for your personal dashboard - GitHub Docs","url":"https://docs.github.com/account-and-profile/setting-up-and-managing-your-github-user-account/managing-user-account-settings/about-your-personal-dashboard"},{"title":"Missing commit notifications on the dashboard view from team repositories · Issue #20763 · go-gitea/gitea","url":"https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/20763"},{"title":"Activity Dashboard not working at all? - Auth0 Community","url":"https://community.auth0.com/t/activity-dashboard-not-working-at-all/111379"},{"title":"Viewing deployment activity for your repository - GitHub Docs","url":"https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/viewing-activity-and-data-for-your-repository/viewing-deployment-activity-for-your-repository"},{"title":"Using Pulse to view a summary of repository activity - GitHub Docs","url":"https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/viewing-activity-and-data-for-your-repository/viewing-a-summary-of-repository-activity"}]

Based on the web search results, I found information related to dashboard activity updates, though the specific "entire.dev" service wasn't directly mentioned in the results. However, the search returned several relevant discussions about activity dashboard issues:

The search results show common dashboard activity issues across various platforms:

- Users have reported that recent activity panels have been removed from dashboards
- Some users have made changes to GitHub repositories but cannot see the contribution history in the activity dashboard
- Instances where home feeds have not been receiving updates and don't show starred repositories' activities, releases, etc., resulting in empty dashboards

Additionally, the updated home dashboard in GitHub now gives visibility into Copilot coding agent sessions, allows tracking of the latest agent sessions triggered, and provides access to agent logs to see progress and manage resulting pull requests and tasks.

If you're experiencing specific issues with the entire.dev dashboard not updating for individual repositories or sessions, you may want to check if there's a refresh needed, verify your session status, or contact the service's support team for more targeted assistance.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

data.prompt: Check the Entire CLI GitHub repo (https://github.com/entireio/cli) for any issues related to the overview activity not updating on the dashboard, even though individual repo sessions are showing up correctly. Look for issues about activity feed, overview, dashboard, or aggregation not updating. Use `gh` CLI or web search to find relevant issues. Report back what you find.

content.text:
Here is my report based on a thorough search.

---

**I did not find any existing issues on the Entire CLI repo (`entireio/cli`) that specifically describe the problem of the overview/activity feed not updating on the dashboard while individual repo sessions display correctly.**

I searched across:
- All ~315 issues (open and closed) on `entireio/cli`
- All GitHub Discussions on the repo
- Issue bodies (not just titles) for keywords: "overview", "dashboard", "activity", "feed", "aggregate", "home page", "not updating"
- All other repos in the `entireio` org (there are only 4 total: `cli`, `homebrew-tap`, `test-repo`, `shared`)
- Web search for the problem

**The closest issues I found are:**

1. **[#250 - "Not seeing any sessions in the web UI?"](https://github.com/entireio/cli/issues/250)** (Open, bug) -- A user reports that despite having checkpoints on the `entire/checkpoints/v1` branch, nothing shows in the web UI at all. A contributor (Soph) noted the user's checkpoint branch had become the default branch, which may have caused the issue. Even after fixing that, the user reports it still shows as the default branch in the Entire UI. This is a broader "nothing shows in web UI" problem, not the specific "overview doesn't update but individual repos do" pattern you described.

2. **[#274 - "Never makes any commits to entire/checkpoints/v1"](https://github.com/entireio/cli/issues/274)** (Open, bug) -- The CLI never creates checkpoint commits at all. The Entire team is investigating.

3. **[#277 - "Checkpoints not created: 'no active sessions' despite correct config"](https://github.com/entireio/cli/issues/277)** (Open, bug) -- The `prepare-commit-msg` hook reports "no active sessions" even during active Claude Code sessions, so checkpoints never get created. Likely related to #274.

4. **[#275 - "Checkpoint data not pushed when agent commits and pushes in the same turn"](https://github.com/entireio/cli/issues/275)** (Open, bug) -- Checkpoint data exists locally but doesn't get pushed to the remote in certain scenarios.

**Bottom line:** The specific issue you're describing -- overview/activity on the dashboard not updating while individual repo sessions are visible -- does not have a filed issue. The Entire web dashboard (entire.dev) appears to be a closed-source product separate from the CLI repo, so dashboard-specific bugs like aggregation or overview rendering may not be tracked in the public `entireio/cli` repo at all. If this is affecting you, it's likely worth filing a new issue on `entireio/cli` (since that's the only public repo for bug reports) or reaching out to the Entire team directly.

content.content:
title:	Checkpoints not created: "no active sessions" despite correct config
state:	OPEN
author:	daeshawnballard
labels:	bug
comments:	3
assignees:	khaong
projects:	
milestone:	
number:	277
--
## Summary

Entire is enabled with `manual-commit` strategy and Claude Code hooks are configured, but no checkpoints are ever created. The logs consistently show `"prepare-commit-msg: no active sessions"` on every commit.

## Environment

- **Entire CLI**: 0.4.2 (2a9998e)
- **Claude Code**: 2.1.7
- **OS**: macOS (darwin/arm64)

## Configuration

- `.entire/settings.json` — `{"strategy": "manual-commit", "enabled": true}`
- `.entire/settings.local.json` — same with telemetry + debug logging enabled
- `.claude/settings.json` — all hooks configured (SessionStart, SessionEnd, UserPromptSubmit, Stop, PreToolUse, PostToolUse)
- Git hooks installed: `prepare-commit-msg`, `commit-msg`, `post-commit`, `pre-push`
- `entire status` → `Enabled (manual-commit)`
- `entire doctor` → `No stuck sessions found.`
- `entire rewind --list` → `[]`

## Steps to Reproduce

1. `entire enable` in a project (reports already enabled, agent: Claude Code)
2. Start a Claude Code session
3. Make changes and commit
4. Check `.entire/logs/entire.log`

## Observed

Every `prepare-commit-msg` hook invocation logs:

```
"msg":"prepare-commit-msg: no active sessions"
```

No checkpoints are created. `entire rewind --list` returns `[]`.

## Expected

Checkpoints should be created when commits are made during an active Claude Code session.

content.text:
Here's the picture:

**You're hitting a known bug in v0.4.2** — issues **#274** and **#277** describe exactly your situation:

- Entire says "Enabled (manual-commit)" 
- `entire doctor` says "No stuck sessions found"
- Git hooks are installed and `prepare-commit-msg` fires
- But the `entire/checkpoints/v1` branch either doesn't exist or only has the initial metadata commit — **no actual checkpoint data gets written**
- The post-commit hook can't find session metadata to associate with the checkpoint, so the web UI shows "no session for this checkpoint"

The root cause appears to be that `prepare-commit-msg` reports "no active sessions" even when Claude Code hooks are correctly firing `session-start`. The session state isn't being recognized when the git hook runs.

**You're now on v0.4.3** — let me check if the changelog or commits mention a fix for this.

content.text:
v0.4.3 (released **today**) includes PR **#272** — `soph/better-git-hook-handling` — which directly addresses the hook handling issues. There are also several related fixes:

- **`better-git-hook-handling`** — the core fix for hooks not properly detecting active sessions
- **`use git hook chaining to not overwrite existing hooks`** — prevents the exact clobbering bug you hit before
- **`safer locking`** and **`store transcript_path into session metadata`** — session state reliability improvements

Now that you're on v0.4.3, you should re-enable Entire in your repos to pick up the new hook handling. Let me reset and re-enable.

content.text:
All good. Here's the summary:

**What was wrong:** v0.4.2 had a bug where `prepare-commit-msg` couldn't detect active sessions, so checkpoints were "created" (trailers appended to commit messages) but never had session metadata written to `entire/checkpoints/v1`. The web UI saw checkpoints with no associated sessions → "no session for this checkpoint."

**What we did:**
1. Updated to **v0.4.3** (released today) — includes `better-git-hook-handling` fix (PR #272)
2. Disabled + re-enabled Entire in all 3 repos to install the new hooks
3. OASIS and sc2-claude-hooks now have their `entire/checkpoints/v1` branches created
4. SC2 sound hooks are intact

Next commit you make from a Claude Code session in any of those repos should properly create a checkpoint with session data. Want to do a test commit to verify?
